catalog_info.title: Behavioral Economics, Law and Public Policy
catalog_info.notes: Offered jointly with the Kennedy School as API-305 and with the Law School at 2589.
catalog_info.description: This seminar will explore a series of issues at the intersection of behavioral economics and public policy. Potential questions will involve climate change; energy efficiency; health care; and basic rights. There will be some discussion of paternalism and the implications of neuroscience as well.
